intro: Kamelinia, commonly known as the desert lily, is a genus of flowering plants native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa, the Middle East, and southern Europe. These plants are characterized by their fleshy, succulent leaves and showy, often fragrant flowers that bloom in shades of white, pink, and purple. Kamelinia species are adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, with deep root systems that help them access groundwater. They play an important role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and stabilizing soil in desert landscapes. Some species are also cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
